ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.2_0: On one occasion a family that was supporting Upananda the Sakyan had invited him a meal.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.4_0: But since Upananda was visiting other families before that meal,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.5_0: the other monks said to that family,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.6_0: “Please give the food to the meal.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.7_0: “Please wait, Sirs, until Venerable Upananda arrives.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.9_0: A third time those monks said,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.10_0: “Please give the meal before the time for eating comes to an end.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.11_0: “But we made the meal because of Venerable Upananda.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.13_0: Then, after visiting those families, Upananda arrived late,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.14_0: and those monks did not eat as much as they had intended.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.15_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.16_0: “How can Venerable Upananda visit families first when invited to a meal?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.17_0: “Is it true, Upananda, that you did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.20_0: “... Foolish man, how can you visit families first when invited to a meal?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.21_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.22_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.23.1_0: ‘If a monk who has been invited to a meal visits families beforehand, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:1.24_0: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.1_0: Soon afterwards a family that was supporting Upananda sent non-staple food to the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.2_0: They gave instructions that the food should be shown to Upananda and then given to the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.3_0: Just then Upananda had entered the village for alms.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.4_0: When those people arrived at the monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.6_0: and they were told where he was.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.7_0: “Venerable, this food should be given to Venerable Upananda.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.9_0: After giving a teaching, the Buddha addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.10_0: “Well then, monks, receive it and put it aside until Upananda returns.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.11_0: Knowing that the Buddha had prohibited eating meals at the wrong time, and so after the meal, they waited for the day.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.12_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.13_0: “How can Venerable Upananda visit families after the meal?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.14_0: “Is it true, Upananda, that you do this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.17_0: “... Foolish man, how can you visit families after the meal?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.18_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.19_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.20.1_0: ‘If a monk who has been invited to a meal visits families beforehand or afterwards, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:2.21_0: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:3.1_0: Soon afterwards, because of being afraid of wrongdoing, the monks did not visit families.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:3.2_0: As a result they only obtained a small amount of robe-cloth.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:3.3_0: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Devadatta:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:3.4_0: “Monks, I allow you to visit families at a time of making robes.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:3.5_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:3.6.1_0: ‘If a monk who has been invited to a meal visits families beforehand or afterwards, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:3.7_0: This is the appropriate occasion: it is the robe-giving season.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:3.8_0: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:4.8_0: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:5.2_0: But being afraid of wrongdoing, they did not visit families.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:5.3_0: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Devadatta:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:5.4_0: “Monks, I allow you to visit families after taking leave of an available monk.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc46:5.5_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
